intro: Oenanthe thracica, commonly known as the Thrace water-dropwort, is a flowering plant native to the Balkan region. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows in moist or aquatic environments. The plant has slender stems and small, greenish-white flowers that bloom in late summer. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a mild, somewhat bitter taste. Oenanthe thracica is part of theApiaceae family, which includes other plants like carrots and parsley.
